content.description:
Sit start with a high right hand incut edge, a low left hand incut edge, and foot out to the right. From there, crank with the right hand, bring the feet underneath, then work up to a left hand incut edge (crux?), reach a sloping right hand, then hit the big shelf with the left, and mantle atop the boulder.

The right hand start hold was just within my reach, and I really had to stretch for it. Those who are shorter may benefit from adding an extra pad at the start.
content.protection: A pad or two will do it, the landing is clear but slightly sloping.
content.location: It ascends the left side of Puce's east face.

content.description:
Exceptional Mediocrity climbs an undercut slab on some of the finest rock in Unaweep. The movement is awkward but well worth a visit.

Sit start with hands matched on the obvious jug. From there, either crank up and mantle to the sloping edge above, or just crank up to the edge (this worked for me), then gather your feet, reach a left hand sloper, and finish straight up the remaining slab on good edges.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Puce's east face.

content.description: Stand start with a thin, left hand crimp and a right hand, incut sidepull. From there, gain a sloping left hand three finger edge (crux?), then follow with both hands to a good shelf below the lip, work the feet up, and top it out using the good bumps.
content.protection: A few pads will work just fine, the landing is clear but gently sloping.
content.location:
It climbs the east face of Puce Boulder, it is just to the right of

Slate Lick Stunner

.
